framework_info.framework_name: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
framework_info.framework_description: The Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) is a set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that accept, process, store or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment. PCI DSS applies to all entities involved in payment card processing including merchants, processors, acquirers, issuers, and service providers.

sections.title: Introduction: Protecting Cardholder Data with PCI Security Standards

policies.policy_description: Establishes requirements for protecting cardholder data throughout the payment card processing ecosystem to mitigate risks of financial fraud and data breaches.
policies.policy_text: It is imperative that you use standard security procedures and technologies to thwart theft of cardholder data. Merchant-based vulnerabilities may appear almost anywhere in the card-processing ecosystem including point-of-sale devices, mobile devices, personal computers or servers, wireless hotspots, web shopping applications, paper-based storage systems, and the transmission of cardholder data to service providers.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all merchants, service providers, and acquirers involved in payment card transactions. It encompasses all systems, applications, and processes that handle cardholder data, including point-of-sale systems, e-commerce platforms, and data storage solutions.
policies.objective: The primary objective of this policy is to ensure the protection of cardholder data from unauthorized access and theft, thereby maintaining consumer trust and compliance with PCI DSS requirements. Specific objectives include: (1) identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities in the card-processing ecosystem; (2) ensuring secure handling and transmission of cardholder data; (3) promoting awareness of security standards among all stakeholders.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: Establishes requirements for identifying and managing vulnerabilities in systems that process cardholder data.
subpolicies.subpolicy_text: Merchants must regularly assess their systems for vulnerabilities and implement appropriate security measures to mitigate identified risks.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Conduct regular vulnerability assessments and implement security patches. WHO: IT Security team and system administrators. WHEN: At least quarterly and after any significant system changes. HOW: Use automated scanning tools and manual reviews. WHERE: All systems involved in cardholder data processing.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: Defines requirements for securely transmitting cardholder data to prevent interception and unauthorized access.
subpolicies.subpolicy_text: All cardholder data transmitted over networks must be encrypted using strong encryption protocols.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Encrypt cardholder data during transmission. WHO: IT Security team and network administrators. WHEN: Continuously during data transmission. HOW: Use TLS 1.2 or higher for all network communications. WHERE: All network paths that transmit cardholder data.

subpolicies.subpolicy_description: Establishes access control measures to ensure that only authorized personnel can access cardholder data.
subpolicies.subpolicy_text: Access to cardholder data must be restricted based on the principle of least privilege.
subpolicies.control: WHAT: Implement role-based access controls for systems handling cardholder data. WHO: IT Security team and access management personnel. WHEN: At the time of user account creation and during periodic access reviews. HOW: Use access control lists and role definitions. WHERE: All systems and applications that store or process cardholder data.

policies.policy_description: Establishes requirements for ongoing compliance with the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) to protect cardholder data.
policies.policy_text: This policy outlines the three ongoing steps for adhering to PCI DSS: Assess, Repair, and Report.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units, personnel, systems, and processes involved in payment card processing, including merchants, service providers, and payment processors.
policies.objective: The primary objective of this policy is to ensure continuous compliance with PCI DSS requirements, thereby protecting cardholder data and maintaining the integrity of payment card transactions.

sections.title: Security Controls and Processes for PCI DSS Requirements

policies.policy_description: Establishes the requirements for ongoing compliance with PCI DSS, including assessment, remediation, and reporting processes.
policies.policy_text: The PCI DSS compliance process involves three ongoing steps: Assess, Repair, and Report. Organizations must identify all locations of cardholder data, inventory IT assets and business processes for payment card processing, analyze vulnerabilities, fix identified vulnerabilities, securely remove unnecessary cardholder data storage, and document assessment and remediation details.
policies.scope: This policy applies to all organizational units, personnel, systems, and processes involved in payment card processing and compliance with PCI DSS. It encompasses all entities that store, process, or transmit cardholder data, including merchants, service providers, and payment processors.
policies.objective: The primary objective of this policy is to ensure continuous compliance with PCI DSS requirements, thereby protecting cardholder data and maintaining the integrity of payment card transactions. Specific objectives include: (1) identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities; (2) ensuring secure handling of cardholder data; (3) maintaining accurate compliance documentation.
